intro: Valerianella diodon, commonly known as the dwarf valerian, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters, with slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and they emit a subtle, pleasant fragrance. Valerianella diodon is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
